title: SST Ticket Types — Canonical Taxonomy (v1)
text:
There are 5 ticket choices for SkyShowTime (SST) imagery operations:

1) Make New Package — No image assets for this film/series/season exist in PMAM. Create the complete standard package of 295 assets (149 images, 146 PSDs) sized and named correctly. Typical cues: 'new title', 'nothing in PMAM', 'need full set', 'no assets found'.

2) Add Missing Image Assets — A partial package exists in PMAM but some assets are missing. Common causes: missing episode images (drop-by-drop deliveries), missing localizations, or special filename variants. Typical cues: 'episodes 5–7 missing', 'need Spanish localization', 'append MVPD in filename'.

3) Update Existing Image Status — Assets have been uploaded to PMAM but still need to be pushed to Atom so they appear on the streaming platform. This depends on corresponding videos being present in PMAM. Typical cues: 'images missing on platform', 'push to Atom', 'launch date is in X days'.

4) Change Existing Image Assets — Replace, revise, or fix assets already created. Examples: swap English to Spanish for a territory with localized metadata, studio-provided art change, quality fixes. May target a single asset type, multiple types, or the entire package. Typical cues: 'swap to Spanish', 'new studio key art', 'quality issue — redo'.

5) I'm Unsure — Requester does not know the right choice. The system should infer the likely type. If >=95% confident, recommend the correct choice and explain briefly. Otherwise ask targeted questions to clarify.

title: SST Asset Types — Canonical Definitions (v1)
text:
Asset families for SST imagery:
- Key Art (KA): Poster art with artwork + Title Treatment (TT). No actor names, dates, or extra text.
- Iconic Art: KA without TT (English localization only).
- Title Treatment (TT): Pure title artwork. Must be pure white; no blending modes, drop shadows, or special effects. If illegible on dark background, ensure white rendering for legibility.
- Immersive Highlight (IH): Cinematic still (screenshot-like) representing the content.
- Episodics: IH-style images per episode (series only). Two aspect ratios per episode.

Series means TV series; Film means movie.
Standard package size when not counting episodes: 295 assets (149 images, 146 PSDs). Series deliverables additionally scale by episode count × 2 aspect ratios.

title: Localization & Territories — Canonical Rules (v1)
text:
SST operates across 20 territories. Each territory may require localized Title Treatment (TT). Localization implies TT text is in the territory's language and must be swapped into:
- KA (replace English TT with localized TT)
- TT standalone deliverables
Iconic Art remains without TT (English-only policy).

When localization is requested:
1) Confirm which territories need localized TT.
2) Verify availability/approval of localized TT source.
3) For series, confirm if episode-level assets also require language-specific variants or only KA/TT.
4) Ensure filenames and metadata reflect correct language codes and territory identifiers.

Special case: MVPD variant (Spanish images with 'MVPD' appended in filename while changing language code to EN). Treat this as an 'Add Missing Image Assets' variant request targeting filenames/variants.

title: Routing Logic — Decide Ticket Type from Free-Text (v1)
text:
High-level decision sequence for classifying a request from free text:

A) Signals for 'Make New Package':
- Phrases: 'new title', 'no assets exist', 'cannot find anything in PMAM', 'need complete package', 'make all artwork'.
- Offer details: film vs series vs season; confirm 295-base set + episodics (if series).

B) Signals for 'Add Missing Image Assets':
- Phrases: 'some assets missing', 'episodes X–Y missing', 'need Spanish/other localization added', 'add MVPD filename variant', 'partial set present'.
- Confirm which assets, episodes, territories, or variants are missing.

C) Signals for 'Update Existing Image Status':
- Phrases: 'images missing on platform', 'push to Atom', 'go-live/launch is in N days', 'not visible on platform'.
- Verify images exist in PMAM; check dependency on corresponding videos.

D) Signals for 'Change Existing Image Assets':
- Phrases: 'replace English with Spanish', 'studio changed art', 'quality issues', 'switch to different KA/IH', 'redo with new specs'.
- Scope can be one asset type, multiple, or entire package. Confirm scope before action.

E) 'I'm Unsure':
- If ≥95% confidence in a single category, recommend it and explain briefly citing cues.
- Otherwise, ask targeted disambiguation questions (see below).

title: Disambiguation Questions — Only When Needed (v1)
text:
Ask only minimal, targeted questions when confidence <95%:

1) Existence in PMAM:
- 'Do any image assets for this title already exist in PMAM (yes/no)?'
  • If 'no' → likely 'Make New Package'.
  • If 'yes' → proceed to 2.

2) Scope of request:
- 'Are specific assets or episodes missing, or are you asking to push to platform?'
  • Missing specifics → 'Add Missing Image Assets'.
  • Push to platform/Atom → 'Update Existing Image Status'.

3) Change vs add:
- 'Do you want to replace or revise assets already created (e.g., swap English to Spanish, studio art change, quality fix)?'
  • Replace/revise existing → 'Change Existing Image Assets'.

4) Localization specifics:
- 'Which territories and languages require localized TT? Do you have approved localized TT sources?'

5) Series episodes:
- 'How many episodes and which are missing? Confirm both aspect ratios per episode.'

title: LLM Output Schema for Ticket Validation
text:
LLM MUST return strict JSON with fields:
{
  "is_match": true|false,                  // whether user-selected type matches inferred type
  "inferred_type": "Make New Package" | "Add Missing Image Assets" | "Update Existing Image Status" | "Change Existing Image Assets" | "I'm Unsure",
  "confidence": 0.0-1.0,                  // calibrated model confidence
  "reason": "short explanation citing key cues",
  "missing_info": ["question1", ...],     // empty if confidence >= 0.95 or not needed
  "recommended_next_action": "string"     // e.g., "Proceed with Add Missing Image Assets for episodes 5–7"
}

Validation rules:
- If the user selected 'I'm Unsure', set is_match=false and infer the best type. If confidence ≥0.95, recommend action; else provide 1–3 concise questions.
- If inferred_type differs from selection, explain plainly (no chain-of-thought) referencing retrieved context.

title: Common Confusions — Contrastive Guidance
text:
Make New Package vs Add Missing Image Assets:
- New Package: zero assets exist in PMAM for the given title/season.
- Add Missing: some assets exist; request is to add specific missing items (episodes, localizations, variants).

Add Missing Image Assets vs Change Existing Image Assets:
- Add Missing adds what is absent.
- Change Existing modifies or replaces assets that already exist (e.g., swap English→Spanish, new studio KA, quality fixes).

Update Existing Image Status vs Add/Change:
- Update Status is about pushing already-uploaded PMAM images to Atom/platform (pipeline state), not creating/replacing assets.

Localization nuances:
- KA and TT require localized TT swaps where territories need localization.
- Iconic Art remains TT-less (English-only policy).

title: Hard Negative Contrast 1
text: I see KA and TT already in PMAM for 'Starlight', but episodics 1–2 are missing. Can you complete those?

metadata.rationale: Reason: assets exist → not 'Make New Package'. Missing episodics → 'Add Missing Image Assets'.

title: Hard Negative Contrast 2
text: We need to replace the English KA in Spain with a Spanish TT version; current English art already exists.

metadata.rationale: Reason: replacement of existing assets → 'Change', not 'Add Missing'.

title: Hard Negative Contrast 3
text: Images are present in PMAM but not on platform; please make them visible.

title: Indexing & Retrieval Hints
text:
Chunking guidance:
- Use semantic chunks ~400–800 tokens for policies; keep examples 1-per-line (already small).
- Attach metadata: {'namespace':'sst_ticketing','doc_type', 'labels', 'version'}.

Query expansion:
- Normalize synonyms: 'push to platform'≈'push to Atom'≈'publish imagery'.
- Map 'new set', 'full package', 'nothing in PMAM' → 'Make New Package'.
- Map 'episodes missing', 'localization needed', 'MVPD filename' → 'Add Missing Image Assets'.
- Map 'not visible on platform', 'go-live soon' → 'Update Existing Image Status'.
- Map 'replace', 'swap', 'redo', 'quality fix', 'new KA from studio' → 'Change Existing Image Assets'.

Re-ranking:
- Favor examples/policies with the same asset family, territory, and episodic context as the query.
- Downweight outdated or mismatched season/episode references.
